intro: Monticalia schultzei subsp. sevillana, commonly known as the Seville monticalia, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and is typically found in rocky or limestone habitats. It is a perennial shrub that thrives in Mediterranean climates with mild, wet winters and hot, dry summers. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
